tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE ingredients (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
  quantity INT NOT NULL,
  unit VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL
)
CREATE TABLE ingredients ( ingredient_id INT PRIMARY KEY, ingredient_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, quantity INT NOT NULL, unit VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL );

CREATE TABLE shopping_list ( list_id INT PRIMARY KEY, list_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, ingredient_id INT NOT NULL, quantity_needed INT NOT NULL, FOREIGN KEY (ingredient_id) REFERENCES ingredients(ingredient_id) );

CREATE TABLE ingredients (id INT PRIMARY KEY,
name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
quantity INT NOT NULL,
unit VARCHAR(50),
expiration_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE recipes (id INT PRIMARY KEY,
name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
description TEXT,
instructions TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE meal_plans (id INT PRIMARY KEY,
name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
planned_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE shopping_lists (id INT PRIMARY KEY,
name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
created_date DATE
)
CREATE TABLE ingredients (ingredient_id INT PRIMARY KEY, ingredient_name VARCHAR(255), quantity INT);
CREATE TABLE meals (meal_id INT PRIMARY KEY, meal_name VARCHAR(255), servings INT);
CREATE TABLE meal_ingredients (meal_id INT, ingredient_id INT, FOREIGN KEY (meal_id) REFERENCES meals(meal_id), FOREIGN KEY (ingredient_id) REFERENCES ingredients(ingredient_id));
CREATE TABLE shopping_lists (list_id INT PRIMARY KEY, list_name VARCHAR(255));
CREATE TABLE list_items (list_id INT, ingredient_id INT, quantity INT, FOREIGN KEY (list_id) REFERENCES shopping_lists(list_id), FOREIGN KEY (ingredient_id) REFERENCES ingredients(ingredient_id));
